Character.description: An abstract character as defined by the Unicode Standard, Version 5, in Chapter 3.4.
Character.label: character

GeographicRegion.description: Geographic regions on Earth or elsewhere.
GeographicRegion.label: geographic region

Language.description: Groups of human language variants that are or were spoken, written, or signed at some point in time.
Language.label: language

Script.description: A writing system considered abstractly, i.e. independent of language-specific variations.
Script.label: script

Term.description: A term in a specific language.
Term.label: term

broader.description: The property of having a broader, more generic concept.
broader.label: broader

narrower.description: The property of having a narrower, less generic concept.
narrower.label: narrower

characterRadical.description: The property of a CJK character being conventionally associated with a CJK character radical.
characterRadical.label: translation

containsCharacter.description: The property of a term containing a specific character.
containsCharacter.label: contains character

evokes.description: The property of conceptually evoking some object.
evokes.label: evokes

hasCharacterComponent.description: The property of a character being composed of another character.
hasCharacterComponent.label: character component

hasMember.description: The property of having a member.
hasMember.label: has member

memberOf.description: The property of being a member of a group.
memberOf.label: member of

inScript.description: The property of a document being written in a specific script, or a language being written or having being written in a specific script by a considerable group of language users.
inScript.label: in script

involvedIn.description: The property of being involved in something, e.g. for semantic participants' involvement in a semantic frame.
involvedIn.label: involved in

involves.description: The property of involving some entity, e.g. for semantic participants involved in a semantic frame.
involves.label: involves

label.description: If C lvont:Label L and L skosxl:literalForm V, then X rdfs:label V.
label.label: has label

means.description: the semiotic property of a natural language word meaning something, i.e. a relationship between words and resources that they represent (or represented) to a considerable number of humans
means.label: means

language.description: The property of a resource being mainly encoded in a specific language.
language.label: in language

lexicalCategory.description: A lexical category that a term can be used in.
lexicalCategory.label: lexical category

represents.description: the semiotic property of semantically representing something, i.e. a relationship between words and other signs and resources that they represent (or represented) to a considerable number of humans
represents.label: represents

scriptFor.description: The property of a script being used for a particular language by a considerable of language users (but not necessarily the majority of all language users).
scriptFor.label: script for

usesScript.description: The property of a language being written or having being written in a specific script by a considerable group of language users.
usesScript.label: uses script

strength.description: The strength of an rdf:Statement, given is a value in [0,1].
strength.label: strength

usedIn.description: The property of a language or writing system being used somewhat extensively in a particular geographical region at some point in time.
usedIn.label: used in

variant.description: The property of being a variant of another resource.
variant.label: variant

nonRadicalStrokes.description: The property of a character conventionally being written with a specific number strokes, excluding the strokes of its radical.
nonRadicalStrokes.label: non-radical strokes
